measured_by: MODe (Metric for the Observation of Decision-making in cancer multidisciplinary tumor boards)
justification: "The MODe tool ... has been used to understand, assess, and improve MTB working," indicating MODe is the instrument for evaluating decision-making quality in tumor-board meetings.
construct: Decision-making quality in multidisciplinary tumor boards

justification: The authors developed "a more user-friendly version of MODe, namely, MODe-Lite, which is intended to be used in clinical practice" for assessing and improving MTB decision-making.
construct: Decision-making quality in multidisciplinary tumor boards

justification: Phase 2 describes external validation "against case complexity as measured by the previously validated Measure of case-Discussion Complexity (MeDiC)."
In Phase 1, the experts retained a separate "clinical input" domain within MODe-Lite to be scored when assessing team quality.
The paper notes that "holistic inputs tend to be underrepresented... hence scoring the holistic input separately" within MODe-Lite.
Experts agreed that "clinical collaboration" should be "scored separately" resulting in a dedicated domain in MODe-Lite.
Pathology was "retained as separate domains (I-CVI=1)" in MODe-Lite to capture the quality of pathology information and input.
construct: Pathology information quality in MTB meetings

justification: Similarly, radiology "were retained as separate domains" in MODe-Lite, indicating it measures radiology information quality.
construct: Radiology information quality in MTB meetings

justification: The "Management plan, which was an outcome variable... was also retained (I-CVI=1) as a separate item" in MODe-Lite.
construct: Management plan quality in MTB meetings
